results.title: An Eye for the job
results.creator_credit: Nigel Miller, Kevin Sim and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Discovery”.
A documentary about the quiet revolution in the operating theatre. The surgeon has now harnessed his skills to the microscope, and operations of the most minute detail are achieved with microsurgery. Depicts five case studies - a blind painter is made to see again, a deaf grandmother can hear again, a worker’s torn off hand is restored, a man’s severed thumb is replaced by his big toe, and a young woman has her fallopian tubes untied.

results.title: Muscular and mechanical movements
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Digestion”.
Deals with the muscular processes involved in the digestion of food. The film demonstrates mechanical and muscular processes of mastication and swallowing; peristalsis in the oesophagus, small intestine, and colon; segmentation in the small intestine; contraction waves in the cardiac and pyloric regions of the stomach; absorption of food into the blood from the small intestine, and of water and salts from the colon. No other credits available.

group_siblings.title: Chemical changes

results.title: Chemical changes
results.creator_credit: Beryl Denman Lacey and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Digestion”.
An account of the chief changes involved in the chemical breakdown of the main types of food during digestion. Shows the secretion of saliva and its action on cooked starch; the gastric glands; secretion of intestinal bile and pancreatic juice and their effect on proteins, carbohydrates and fats; the absorption of nutrients through the villi and lacteals into the blood and its subsequent circulation through the body.

results.title: Cognitive development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Describes and portrays two major theories of cognitive development: Jean Piaget’s developmental stage approach with its emphasis on maturational and environmental factors; and the cognitive learning or cognitive behavioural approach subscribed to by such developmentalists as Jerome Bruner, Jerome Kagan and Sidney Bijou. Suitable for tertiary and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Language development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Shows the most current research being done on language development, such as Dr David Premack’s work at the University of California teaching language to chimpanzees. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Prenatal development
results.creator_credit: Barbara Jampel, CRM Educational Films and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Emphasizes the importance of environment influences on the human foetus. Traces foetal development from conception to birth. Discusses the effects of a deficient diet, drugs taken by the mother and her state of pregnancy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Jampel, CRM Educational Films and McGraw-Hill Films

results.title: Infancy
results.creator_credit: Glen Howard, Howard Gardner, Jerome Kagan, Bay State Film Productions and Harper & Row
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Examines behaviour and cognitive patterns characteristic of the first 18 months of life, including object permanence, stranger and separation anxiety, reaction to discrepancy and maturing co-ordinations. Discusses individual differences in infant temperament.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Glen Howard, Howard Gardner, Jerome Kagan, Bay State Film Productions and Harper & Row

results.title: Emotional development: aggression
results.creator_credit: Barbara Jampel, CRM Educational Films and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Aggression is one of the least understood emotions. This film looks at the ways it is leant, when it is used and how aggressive skills are maintained. Alternatives to aggression such as co-operation and negotiation are also examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Jampel, CRM Educational Films and McGraw-Hill Films
